page.title: 13EVENTS IN THE NEWS
page.content: {27TH JUNE 1985. Peterborough's Perkins Engines, who are the biggest of Peterborough's employers are helping Sudan and Ethiopia. Sudan, which is one of the countries struck by famine, has reveived one of Perkins Engines' own 4.236 diesel engines. Th engine will be used to power a pumping unit which has been given to a person from the Sudanese government three days ago at the factory. The pumping unit is worth Â£5,500 and is able to pump 53,000 gallons per hour at a maximun height of 42 metres.The project has been organised by the aid organisation "Christian Outreach".
